pageContext.claim: “Certainly, even if you go back into 1917, that was the worst of all time, but it was also not as bad here. It was very bad. It was very rough. It was a bad one, but it wasn't -- it wasn't -- wasn't quite like what we're going through right now. And it's because of the amazing -- when you look at how contagious this is, where people literally just being in the same area with other people, it's -- it catches.”
pageContext.analysis: The Centers for Disease Control {still call} the 1918 pandemic the “most severe in recent history.” With more than one-third of the world’s population becoming infected, there were more cases and deaths than there have been from covid-19. That said technology has also vastly improved.
